title: 108_s2510
content: CREDIT FOR INSTALLATION OF HYDROGEN FUELING STATIONS. A new section is added to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for a HYDROGEN-POWERED VEHICLE REFUELING PROPERTY CREDIT. The tax code allows a credit for 50% of the amount paid for qualified hydrogen-powered vehicle refueling property. The credit is given in the year the property is placed in service by the taxpayer. Qualified property must be depreciable, have its original use with the taxpayer, and not include a building or its structural components. The tax code allows a credit for 50% of the amount paid for qualified hydrogen-powered vehicle refueling property. The credit is given in the year the property is placed in service by the taxpayer. Qualified property must be depreciable, have its original use with the taxpayer, and not include a building or its structural components. The credit allowed for any taxable year is subject to certain limitations and basis reduction rules. The tax code allows a credit for qualified hydrogen-powered vehicle refueling property. Excess credit can be carried forward for 20 years. Special rules and regulations apply. The tax code provides a credit for qualified hydrogen-powered vehicle refueling property, with excess credit carryforward for 20 years. Amendments are made to sections 1016(a) and 55(c)(2) of the Code, and a new section 30B is added. The tax code includes a credit for hydrogen-powered vehicle refueling property and excludes earnings from hydrogen fuel sales. The tax code excludes income from hydrogen fuel sales for use in hydrogen fuel cell vehicles until December 31, 2013. The tax code excludes income from hydrogen fuel sales for use in hydrogen fuel cell vehicles until December 31, 2013. The amendments made by this section apply to income received after December 31, 2003, in taxable years ending after such date.
